noted, for example by Save the Children-UK ( 14). (This programme is discussed later.) 
Evaluations and assessments of operational programmes gradually built up from findings from 
large-scale programmes as they expanded from the 1980s on. Based on this development, 
some 61 projects, mostly large scale, have been reviewed (see Table II-1), representing most 
of the programmes considered relevant over about the last 30 years. Some of the early projects,
